parameters.description: object name
parameters.name: name

parameters.description: Avi Tenant Header
parameters.name: X-Avi-Tenant

parameters.description: Avi Tenant Header UUID
parameters.name: X-Avi-Tenant-UUID

parameters.description: The caller is required to set Avi Version Header to the expected version of configuration. The response from the controller will provide and accept data according to the specified version. The controller will reject POST and PUT requests where the data is not compatible with the specified version.
parameters.name: X-Avi-Version

parameters.description: Avi Controller may send back CSRF token in the response cookies. The caller should update the request headers with this token else controller will reject requests.
parameters.name: X-CSRFToken

parameters.name: X-CSRFToken

parameters.name: uuid

parameters.description: List of fields to be returned for the resource. Some fields like name, URL, uuid etc. are always returned.
parameters.name: fields

parameters.description: All the Avi REST reference URIs have a name suffix as URI#name. It is useful to get the referenced resource name without performing get on that object.
parameters.name: include_name

parameters.description: Default values are not set.
parameters.name: skip_default

parameters.description: It automatically returns additional dependent resources like runtime. Eg. join_subresources=runtime.
parameters.name: join_subresources

parameters.description: Filter to request all objects that refers to another Avi resource. Its syntax is refers_to=<obj_type>:<obj_uuid>. Eg. get all virtual services referring to pool p1 will be refers_to=pool:pool_p1_uuid
parameters.name: refers_to

parameters.description: Filter to request all objects that are referred by another Avi resource. Its syntax is referred_by=<obj_type>:<obj_uuid>. Eg. get all pools referred_by virtual service vs1 - referred_by=virtualservice:vs_vs1_uuid
parameters.name: referred_by

parameters.description: List of fields to be returned for the resource. Some fields like name, URL, uuid etc. are always returned.
parameters.name: fields

parameters.description: All the Avi REST reference URIs have a name suffix as URI#name. It is useful to get the referenced resource name without performing get on that object.
parameters.name: include_name

parameters.description: Default values are not set.
parameters.name: skip_default

parameters.description: It automatically returns additional dependent resources like runtime. Eg. join_subresources=runtime.
parameters.name: join_subresources

parameters.name: X-CSRFToken

single_signon_url.description: Single Signon URL to be programmed on the IDP. Field introduced in 17.2.3.

entity_id.description: Globally unique entityID for this node. Entity ID on the IDP should match this. Field introduced in 17.2.3.

name.description: Refers to the Cluster name identifier (Virtual IP or FQDN). Field introduced in 17.2.3.

signing_cert.description: Service Provider signing certificate for metadata. Field deprecated in 18.2.1. Field introduced in 17.2.3.

signing_key.description: Service Provider signing key for metadata. Field deprecated in 18.2.1. Field introduced in 17.2.3.

signing_ssl_key_and_certificate_ref.description: Service Engines will use this SSL certificate to sign assertions going to the IdP. It is a reference to an object of type SSLKeyAndCertificate. Field introduced in 18.2.1.

user_search_dn.description: LDAP user search DN is the root of search for a given user in the LDAP directory. Only user records present in this LDAP directory sub-tree will be validated.

group_member_is_full_dn.description: Group member entries contain full DNs instead of just user id attribute values.

user_search_scope.description: LDAP user search scope defines how deep to search for the user starting from user search DN. Enum options - AUTH_LDAP_SCOPE_BASE, AUTH_LDAP_SCOPE_ONE, AUTH_LDAP_SCOPE_SUBTREE.

user_id_attribute.description: LDAP user id attribute is the login attribute that uniquely identifies a single user record.

group_member_attribute.description: LDAP group attribute that identifies each of the group members.

group_filter.description: Group filter is used to identify groups during search.

group_search_dn.description: LDAP group search DN is the root of search for a given group in the LDAP directory. Only matching groups present in this LDAP directory sub-tree will be checked for user membership.

group_search_scope.description: LDAP group search scope defines how deep to search for the group starting from the group search DN. Enum options - AUTH_LDAP_SCOPE_BASE, AUTH_LDAP_SCOPE_ONE, AUTH_LDAP_SCOPE_SUBTREE.

user_attributes.description: LDAP user attributes to fetch on a successful user bind.

ignore_referrals.description: During user or group search, ignore searching referrals.

admin_bind_dn.description: LDAP Admin User DN. Administrator credentials are required to search for users under user search DN or groups under group search DN.

service.description: TACACS+ service. Enum options - AUTH_TACACS_PLUS_SERVICE_NONE, AUTH_TACACS_PLUS_SERVICE_LOGIN, AUTH_TACACS_PLUS_SERVICE_ENABLE, AUTH_TACACS_PLUS_SERVICE_PPP, AUTH_TACACS_PLUS_SERVICE_ARAP, AUTH_TACACS_PLUS_SERVICE_PT, AUTH_TACACS_PLUS_SERVICE_RCMD, AUTH_TACACS_PLUS_SERVICE_X25, AUTH_TACACS_PLUS_SERVICE_NASI, AUTH_TACACS_PLUS_SERVICE_FWPROXY.

security_mode.description: LDAP connection security mode. Enum options - AUTH_LDAP_SECURE_NONE, AUTH_LDAP_SECURE_USE_LDAPS.

settings.description: LDAP full directory configuration with administrator credentials.

bind_as_administrator.description: LDAP administrator credentials are used to search for users and group memberships.

full_name_attribute.description: LDAP attribute that refers to user's full name.

base_dn.description: The LDAP base DN.  For example, avinetworks.com would be DC=avinetworks,DC=com.

email_attribute.description: LDAP attribute that refers to user email.

port.description: Query the LDAP servers on this port.

dn_template.description: LDAP user DN pattern is used to bind LDAP user after replacing the user token with real username.

user_attributes.description: LDAP user attributes to fetch on a successful user bind.

token.description: LDAP token is replaced with real user name in the user DN pattern.

user_id_attribute.description: LDAP user id attribute is the login attribute that uniquely identifies a single user record.

metadata.description: SAML IDP metadata. Field introduced in 17.2.3.

sp.description: Configure service provider settings for the Controller. Field introduced in 17.2.3.

idp.description: Configure remote Identity provider settings. Field introduced in 17.2.3.

org_name.description: Service Provider Organization Name. Field introduced in 17.2.3.

org_display_name.description: Service Provider Organization Display Name. Field introduced in 17.2.3.

org_url.description: Service Provider Organization URL. Field introduced in 17.2.3.

tech_contact_name.description: Service Provider technical contact name. Field introduced in 17.2.3.

fqdn.description: FQDN if entity type is DNS_FQDN . Field introduced in 17.2.3.

saml_entity_type.description: Type of SAML endpoint. Enum options - AUTH_SAML_CLUSTER_VIP, AUTH_SAML_DNS_FQDN, AUTH_SAML_APP_VS. Field introduced in 17.2.3.

sp_nodes.description: Service Provider node information. Field introduced in 17.2.3.

tech_contact_email.description: Service Provider technical contact email. Field introduced in 17.2.3.

pa_agent_ref.description: PingAccessAgent uuid. It is a reference to an object of type PingAccessAgent. Field introduced in 18.2.3.

_last_modified.description: UNIX time since epoch in microseconds. Units(MICROSECONDS).

tenant_ref.description: It is a reference to an object of type Tenant.

type.description: Type of the Auth Profile. Enum options - AUTH_PROFILE_LDAP, AUTH_PROFILE_TACACS_PLUS, AUTH_PROFILE_SAML, AUTH_PROFILE_PINGACCESS.

description.description: User defined description for the object.

group_member_is_full_dn.description: Group member entries contain full DNs instead of just user id attribute values. This should now be configured using the LdapDirectorySettings field instead. Field deprecated in 18.2.1.

cache_expiration_time.description: The max allowed length of time a clients authentication is cached. Allowed values are 1-30.

request_header.description: Insert an HTTP header.  This field is used to define the header name.  The value of the header is set to the client's HTTP Auth user ID.

require_user_groups.description: A user should be a member of these groups.  Each group is defined by the DN.  For example, CN=testgroup,OU=groups,dc=example,dc=avinetworks,DC=com.
